Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293 cells transiently transfected with PINK1 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: The c.752T>G variant in PINK1 increased Parkin ubiquitination activity by 30% compared to wild-type.
The c.1234A>T variant reduced PINK1 kinase activity by 40% in HEK293 cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate for Western blot quantification.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control in Western blot experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control for PINK1 expression.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test was used for comparing variant and control groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: PINK1 kinase activity ≥85% of wild-type levels

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: PINK1 kinase activity <70% of wild-type levels

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells were used to assess mitochondrial localization of PINK1 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: The c.752T>G variant showed increased mitochondrial localization compared to wild-type PINK1 in SH-SY5Y cells.
The c.1234A>T variant exhibited reduced mitochondrial accumulation in SH-SY5Y cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for immunofluorescence analysis.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times with independent cell cultures.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 served as a positive control for mitochondrial localization.

Basic negative control.Description: Untransfected SH-SY5Y cells were used as a negative control for PINK1 expression.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used to compare localization patterns.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial PINK1 fluorescence intensity ≥90% of wild-type

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial PINK1 fluorescence intensity <75% of wild-type
